New Records: Lockie Ferguson claimed three wickets without conceding a run off his four overs
Key Match Events: New Zealand chased down 79 in 12.2 overs to win by seven wickets
Papua New Guinea bowled out for 78 off 19.4 overs
Pre-Game Insights: Both sides already eliminated from Super 8s contention
Kane Williamson emphasized adapting to challenging conditions was important
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson: 'The boys did well today. Whatever target you're chasing on that surface is going to be a grind, I'm glad we made it over the line.'
Assad Vala: 'There's lots of learning we can take away from this game, especially the batting aspect of the game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Trent Boult is working his way his way around the boundary, signing things and posing for photos, as it's his last game in the format for New Zealand, and probably his last ever
New Zealand have their second victory - they finished in third in Group C, two points short of the West Indies
Others: The players shake hands, lots of smiles and arms around shoulders. Both sides are heading home.
